intro: Alsine breviflora, commonly known as the short-flowered sandspurry, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is a low-growing perennial that typically thrives in sandy or gravelly soils, often found in arid or semi-arid regions. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers with five petals, and its leaves are usually hairy and succulent. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in harsh environments. Alsine breviflora plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates.
